publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-444 Carolyn Leckie: Food Advertising on TV-That the Parliament notes that research by the University of Strathclyde on behalf of the Food Standards Agency found that TV adverts are responsible for children eating too much sugar, fat and salt and that research by the Food Commission found that food advertising accounts for half of all advertising during children's viewing time and, in light of this research, calls on the Scottish Executive to introduce a ban on the advertising of junk food to children in line with calls from the Scottish Consumer Council, the British Heart Foundation, the Royal College of General Practitioners, the Food Commission and 80 other organisations. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*, Colin Fox*, Frances Curran*

S2M-444 Carolyn Leckie: Food Advertising on TV—That the Parliament notes that research by the University of Strathclyde on behalf of the Food Standards Agency found that TV adverts are responsible for children eating too much sugar, fat and salt and that research by the Food Commission found that food advertising accounts for half of all advertising during children’s viewing time and, in light of this research, calls on the Scottish Executive to introduce a ban on the advertising of junk food to children in line with calls from the Scottish Consumer Council, the British Heart Foundation, the Royal College of General Practitioners, the Food Commission and 80 other organisations. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Tommy Sheridan, Rosie Kane, Colin Fox, Frances Curran, John Swinburne*
S2M-444 Food Advertising on TV (lodged on 2 October 2003) Elaine Smith*, Richard Lochhead*, Ms Sandra White*, Margo MacDonald*
S2M-444 Food Advertising on TV (lodged on 2 October 2003) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Eleanor Scott*, Alex Neil*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-444 Food Advertising on TV (lodged on 2 October 2003) Chris Ballance*
